column14: Fastest rates on increase in RS in the tropics

Tropical forests have the "highest rates" of soil CO2 production; tundra the lowest. High inter-annual variability for global deserts, savannas, shrublands, boreal forest, *and* wetlands (i.e., swamps, bogs, forested wetlands).
Peng and Apps: Simulating global soil-C02 flux and its response to climate change, J. Environ. Sci. , 12, 257–265, 2000.
